name: io.file.buffer.size
description:
The size of buffer for use in sequence files.
  The size of this buffer should probably be a multiple of hardware
  page size (4096 on Intel x86), and it determines how much data is
  buffered during read and write operations.

name: mapreduce.job.end-notification.retry.attempts
description:
The number of times the submitter of the job wants to retry job
    end notification if it fails. This is capped by
    mapreduce.job.end-notification.max.attempts

name: dfs.client.block.write.locateFollowingBlock.initial.delay.ms
description:
The initial delay (unit is ms) for locateFollowingBlock,
    the delay time will increase exponentially(double) for each retry
    until dfs.client.block.write.locateFollowingBlock.max.delay.ms is reached,
    after that the delay for each retry will be
    dfs.client.block.write.locateFollowingBlock.max.delay.ms.

name: dfs.namenode.name.cache.threshold
description:
Frequently accessed files that are accessed more times than this
    threshold are cached in the FSDirectory nameCache.

name: fs.s3a.connection.maximum
description:
Controls the maximum number of simultaneous connections to S3.
    This must be bigger than the value of fs.s3a.threads.max so as to stop
    threads being blocked waiting for new HTTPS connections.
    Why not equal? The AWS SDK transfer manager also uses these connections.
